'''''Pictures under Discussion''''' is a [[1987]] book collecting photographs of and commentary on various famous people, by American photographer John Loengard. The book includes a section about [[J.R.R. Tolkien]] (misspelled "[[Tolkein|Tolkein, J.R.R.]]" in the index). Loengard's commentary (p. 138) consists of a rather negative [[Index:Reminiscences of J.R.R. Tolkien|reminiscence]] about meeting John Ronald and [[Edith Tolkien|Edith]] at a "seaside hotel"<ref group=note>[[Anders Stenström|Beregond, Anders Stenström]] has suggested that the hotel would likely be the Hotel Miramar. ([https://tolkienseminariet.wordpress.com/2017/03/28/16-mars-2017/ Tolkienseminariet], dated 16 March 2017, accessed 6 June 2019)</ref> in [[Bournemouth]]<ref>{{webcite|author=|articleurl=http://www.monroegallery.com/photographers/detail/id/1417|articlename=J. R. R. Tolkien, Bournemouth, England|dated=|website=www.monroegallery.com|accessed=6 June 2019}}</ref> in [[1968]], and a duotone photograph of Tolkien taken by Loengard on the occasion is reproduced on a full-page (p. 139).
